@graph.name: Algorithm
@graph.description: An algorithm is a collection of rules that performs calculations, solutions, and automated tasks.

@graph.name: Deep learning
@graph.description: Deep learning is a subfield of machine learning concerned with algorithms inspired by the structure and function of the brain.

@graph.name: Artificial neural network
@graph.description: An artificial neural network (ANN) is a collection of connected nodes or neurons and connections (synapses) between them. Artificial neural networks are used for a variety of tasks, such as classification, regression, and clustering, and are a type of machine learning algorithm.

@graph.name: Supervised learning
@graph.description: Supervised learning is a machine learning technique wherein a training dataset is used to teach an algorithm what good output should look like. The algorithm then uses this information to make predictions or classifications on new, unseen data.

@graph.name: Unsupervised learning
@graph.description: Unsupervised learning is a machine learning technique wherein a training dataset is used to teach an algorithm what good output should look like. The algorithm then uses this information to make predictions or classifications on new, unseen data.

@graph.name: Semi-supervised learning
@graph.description: Semi-supervised learning is a machine learning technique wherein a training dataset is used to teach an algorithm what good output should look like. The algorithm then uses this information to make predictions or classifications on new, unseen data.

@graph.name: Convolutional neural network
@graph.description: A convolutional neural network (CNN, or ConvNet) is a class of deep neural networks, most commonly applied to visual imagery recognition and processing tasks.

@graph.name: Recurrent neural network
@graph.description: A recurrent neural network (RNN, or RNNet) is a class of artificial neural networks used for sequential data modeling, where the connections between units are not restricted to feedforward direction.

@graph.name: Transformer
@graph.description: A transformer is a class of deep neural networks, originally proposed for natural language processing (NLP) tasks in the Transformer paper.

@graph.name: Machine learning
@graph.description: Machine learning is a subfield of artificial intelligence that deals with the design and development of algorithms that can learn from and make predictions on data.
